title: Katie Holmes cuts a chic figure in a white cosy jumper and jeans as she steps out in New York
text:
She is known for her impeccable sense of style.

And Katie Holmes looked effortlessly chic as she stepped out in New York on Monday.

The actress, 40, wrapped up in an oversized white cosy knit and blue bootcut jeans during her low-key stroll around Manhattan.

Stylish display: Katie Holmes looked effortlessly chic in a white cosy jumper and blue jeans as she stepped out in New York on Monday

Katie added a boost to her statuesque frame with black heeled boots and shrugged a large bag over her shoulder.

Styling her brunette tresses up in a messy bun, the Dawson's Creek star donned a pair of large black oversized shades

Katie, who is newly-single after her long-term relationship with Jamie Foxx came to an end, appeared in high spirits during her solo outing.

Fashionista: Katie added a boost to her statuesque frame with black heeled boots and shrugged a large bag over her shoulder

It emerged the couple had went their separate ways over the summer.

Katie and Jamie were first romantically linked back in 2013, following her divorce from Tom Cruise.

She initially began dating Tom in 2005, and seven weeks into the relationship, they were engaged. Their Scientologist wedding was held at the Castello Orsini-Odescalchi in Bracciano in November 2006, seven months after Suri was born.

Katie filed in 2012 for a divorce that was finalized only 10 days later, with Suri's mother retaining primary custody, though Tom could visit, according to People.

Ron Miscavige, father of Scientology leader David Miscavige, told MailOnline in 2016 that Katie's misgivings about Scientology - including the effect it could have on Suri - contributed to her decision to leave Tom.

Recently, it had been reported Katie was dipping her toes back into the dating pond.

'Her No. 1 priority is meeting someone who can build a strong relationship with Suri. If they don't tick that box, Katie's just not interested,' a source told In Touch Weekly.
